meanings.definition: False or malicious statements about someone.
meanings.sent1: The traducements spread about her were hurtful.
meanings.sent2: He was hurt by the traducements made against him.
meanings.sent3: The traducements about the cat being a spy were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The traducements painted her as a villain in the office drama.
meanings.sent5: The traducements whispered in the school halls were like poison spreading.

meanings.definition: The act of speaking falsely or maliciously about someone.
meanings.sent1: She engaged in traducements to tarnish his reputation.
meanings.sent2: The traducements of the gossip were damaging to her friendships.
meanings.sent3: The traducements at the party were like a game of telephone gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: His traducements were like arrows aimed at her character.
meanings.sent5: The traducements echoed in the courtroom, staining his credibility.
